data.title: Dodge County Middle School
data.meta_description: Dodge County Middle School school profile, performance trends and GA state ranking. See how Dodge County Middle School ranks with other Eastman schools.
data.text:
Summary:

Dodge County Middle School is a public middle school located in Eastman, Georgia, serving grades 6-8 with a student population of 628. The school is part of the Dodge County School District, which is ranked 117 out of 193 districts in Georgia and is rated 2 stars out of 5 by SchoolDigger.

Dodge County Middle School consistently underperforms compared to the state average on the Georgia Milestones Assessments, with proficiency rates in English Language Arts, Science, and Social Studies ranging from 18.6% to 28.6% proficient or better, compared to the state averages of 39.8% to 44.7%. The school also has a high percentage of students eligible for free or reduced-price lunch, ranging from 67.68% to 86.6%, indicating a high level of economic disadvantage among the student population. Dodge County Middle School's statewide ranking among Georgia middle schools has declined over the years, from a high of 235 out of 539 schools in 2016-2017 to a low of 417 out of 578 schools in 2023-2024, with a consistent 1-2 star rating from SchoolDigger.

When compared to the nearby middle schools, such as Telfair County Middle School, Pulaski County Middle School, and Bleckley Middle School, Dodge County Middle School consistently underperforms on academic measures, with lower proficiency rates in core subjects. Bleckley Middle School, in particular, stands out as a higher-performing school, with significantly higher proficiency rates and a higher statewide ranking.

Detail:
